label: University of Pennsylvania LJS 41: Megilat Ester ... etc.
attribution: Provided by the University of Pennsylvania Libraries
description:
Summary: The Book of Esther written on 3 gatherings removed from a miscellany. The first leaf of the first gathering begins with the last 7 verses of the Book of Lamentations, the work that preceded the Book of Esther in the miscellany. The last leaf of the last gathering has been replaced by an added leaf on which are written 2 liturgical poems (Asher Heini, whose beginning is not on the leaf, and Shoshanat Yaʻaḳov) used at Purim along with the Book of Esther.
        Language: Hebrew
        Support: parchment
        Extent: 
        Collation: Parchment, 16; 1⁸ 2-3⁴.
        Layout: Written in 16 long lines.
        Script: Written in semi-square Italian Sephardic script with vowel points and cantillation marks (f. 1-15); poems on added leaf at end written in semi-cursive rabbinic Italian Sephardic script.
        Decoration: 
        Binding: Early parchment over pasteboards.
        Origin: Written in Italy in the 15th century.
        Cite as:	
        UPenn LJS 41
        For catalog record, see Permanent Link: 5797941 http://hdl.library.upenn.edu/1017/d/medren/5797941
  For TEI description and digital images, see: http://openn.library.upenn.edu/Data/LJSchoenbergManuscripts/html/ljs41.html
